text: Hey <@UBF61JD2R>, we’ve been working on a solution to this issue that involves _keeping these classnames_ as part of the new embed HTML structure. With these pending changes you should be able to take advantage of the new plugin without loosing the CSS styling that you were hooking into the old classnames with. I will let you know when these changes are available in Production.
Thank you <@UN0NUBU3S>, I appreciate you updating me on this.

Hey all, I’m using a `mailto:` CTA button in some job descriptions on our HubSpot CMS site. Is there a way to disable the redirect page the CTA routes through? I really just want a nice styled button and a `mailto:` link

Hey <@UMTLE2GMN> You can’t disable the CTA’s redirect functionality as that is the how it tracks the link clicks and more for your CTA stats. If you were looking to make a simple button and didnt care about the tracking stats, you could create a button by adding a CSS class to an `<a href="">` tag and then styling it that way. Then you can go into the “Advanced > Source Code” editor and add the class to the A tag.
Thanks AJ that’s probably what I’ll do
That worked quite well, thanks!

<@UBF61JD2R> the updates are in production, so you should be able to edit the rich text modules and the embedded videos should automatically take back the old responsive CSS classes. Please let me know if this is not the case!

this is a bit of an odd question, but can we set a faivcon for files? like pdfs and the like? Kind of like here: <https://www08.wellsfargomedia.com/assets/pdf/small-business/real-estate/personal-financial-statement.pdf>
To be clear, I am declaring the favicon manually in the head of all my pages, but I am not sure how to have a favicon.ico at the root of my domain since, ya know, its HubSpot...
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-can-i-change-my-favicon>
even though I uploaded a favicon here, I don't get it when loading a pdf from the files manager
Has anyone used HubSpot to develop a #HIPAA Compliant website?
Are your files hosted on the cdn or your site?

There's nothing about HubSpot that is out-of-the-box HIPAA compliant. That said HIPAA is much more about what you say than the software you use to say it. So you might want to take a look at your content (pages, landing pages, and emails) from a HIPAA point of view ( see <https://compliancy-group.com/how-to-make-a-hipaa-compliant-website/>).
If you use formstack in place of HubSpot forms. <https://www.formstack.com/features/hipaa-compliance>
<@UD53A9UUR> our site is hosted by HubSpot, so one in the same?
we're all in on the cms
If you look at the PDF, you should see an option for it to be on the cdn or on your site
Cdn will display HubSpot logo
I think if you change to host on your site, that will update the favicon

Yeah, I switched it to our site, so at least the url is our and not HubSpots, but would love to get a favicon up there too if possible. However, since we don't have root access with our sites (which I wouldn't want to deal with in the first place :wink: ) I was wondering if HubSpot would use our favicon that we uploaded in the site settings for media coming from the file manager. But I am assuming this probably isn't possible
sorry, was typing whil you responded :wink: favicon hasn't updated yet but maybe there is a lag
<@UD53A9UUR> can I ask you one more unrelated ?
Sure thing
when you switch the featured image for a page, how long does it usually take to populate the socials?
a marketing team member posted a link to a page that had an outdated branded feature image and I updated the graphic but now when i try to link to it in linked in it still pulls the old image
Depends on the social platform.   You can rescrape with Facebook debugger. I believe the others have a similar feature, but not quite sure
just wanted to set expectations to the higher ups :wink:
Good luck!
thanks man! enjoy your evening! (I am assuming you are us based)
Yup!

New to HubSpot and never used video on the platform before. I'm confused about the new HubSpot Vidyard integration. Is this necessary, and if not, what value does it add over uploading video directly to HubSpot File Manager? Would I need to subscribe to Vidyard ($150 month minimum). I'd rather not do that, so what are my limitations with pure HubSpot-uploaded video (I'm not using youtube or other video platforms).
Thanks.
You can host up to 3 videos for free. <https://wistia.com/pricing>
